body_html:
Hi!

I think the use of sequence_loss_by_example in ptb_word_lm in ok, because sequence_loss_by_example averages across time-steps (not batch), but ptb_word_lm uses it with just 1 time-step -- it first puts the time component into the batch dimenstion. That's why it has the reshape, but the lists are all of length 1 -- that's the time dimenstion and that's why you see "batch_size * num_steps" there in weights.

Hope that clarifies it!

Lukasz
